or use our customer service tab on the website) If you do encounter an accessibility issue, please be sure to specify the Web page/URL in your email, and we will make all reasonable efforts to address your concerns.

What is your job?:

.visual-form-builder-container

Welcome to Hamilton County, FL – Your Gateway to North Florida’s Natural Beauty!
Discover Hamilton County: Nestled in the heart of North Florida, Hamilton County is a hidden gem waiting to be explored. Our county is brimming with natural beauty, rich history, and a warm community spirit that welcomes visitors with open arms. Whether you’re a resident or a first-time guest, we invite you to embark on an adventure in Hamilton County.
Explore Our Natural Wonders: Hamilton County is a nature lover’s paradise, offering pristine rivers, lush forests, and abundant wildlife. Spend your days hiking, paddling, or fishing in our unspoiled outdoor playground. The Suwannee, Alapaha, and Withlacoochee Rivers are the perfect backdrop for a serene getaway.
History and Culture: Immerse yourself in our history and culture with visits to historic sites and museums. Hamilton County’s past is woven with tales of bravery and resilience, and our cultural heritage reflects the charm of the Old South.
Hamilton County Tourist Development Council: We take pride in promoting tourism and welcoming travelers to our hometown. The Hamilton County Tourist Development Council plays a crucial role in this endeavor. They meet every second Tuesday of the month at 12:30 PM in the Courthouse Annex Conference Room. We encourage community members to join us and become a part of our mission to showcase the wonders of Hamilton County to the world.
Get Involved: We believe that tourism is a community effort. By joining us, you can make a difference in promoting our beloved county. Share your ideas, expertise, and love for Hamilton County to help us create memorable experiences for visitors.
Stay Connected: To stay updated on the latest events, activities, and tourism opportunities in Hamilton County, be sure to explore our website and follow us on social media.
Welcome to Hamilton County, where natural beauty, history, and community come together. We can’t wait to share our corner of Florida with you!
Hamilton County Tourist Development Council meetings and initiatives are carried out in accordance with all applicable local regulations and guidelines.
Hours of Operation
8:30 a.m. – 4:30 p.m.
Monday – Friday
Contact
1153 NW Hwy 41, Suite 9
Jasper, FL 32052
Cell/Text: (386) 855-5304
Email:
[email protected]
Website:
www.visithamiltonfl.com

Emergency Management
In case of an emergency please dial 911
Hamilton County Office of Emergency Management Web Site –
www.HamiltonEM.com
Services
The Hamilton County Emergency Management Office is responsible for coordinating the following:
Hurricane preparation classes
Safety training for schools & civic organizations
Public training information
Public assistance after floods, fires, tornadoes, hurricanes, etc.
Mitigation of hazards and hazardous materials
Links
Hamilton County Emergency Management
Hurricane Preparation Information from the American Red Cross
National Hurricane Center Website
– with downloadable hurricane tracking charts, Latest tropical storm forcasts, latest satellite imagery, hurricane preparation information and more!
Hamilton County Sheriff’s Office Division of Emergency
Hours of Operation
8:30 a.m. – 4:30 p.m.
Monday – Friday
Contact
Henry Land, Emergency Management Director
1133 US 41 N.W. Suite 1
Jasper, FL 32052
Phone: (386) 792-6647
Fax: (386) 792-6648
Email:
[email protected]

Board of County Commissioners
The Hamilton County Board of County Commissioners is a five-member board elected to serve the citizens of Hamilton County. Commissioners are elected for a four-year term by voters in the district they represent. The Board of County Commissioners establish local government policy and manage operation of the County Road Department, Emergency Medical Services, Land Use Administration, SHIP, Solid Waste, County Recreation, Building Department, Economic Development, Veteran Services, Agricultural Extension Office, and Maintenance. The Board of County Commissioners adopts the millage rate annually and approves the County budget, which determines the expenditures and revenue necessary to operate all County Services. Florida Statutes Chapter 125 establishes the powers and duties of the Board of County Commissioners.
The Hamilton County Board of County Commissioners meet regularly on the first Tuesday of each month beginning at 9 AM and the third Tuesday of each month beginning at 6 PM. Meetings are held in the Boardroom located at 207 NE First Street Jasper, Florida 32052.
